description: From Middle English resilient, from Old French resilient, from Latin resiliēns, present active participle of resiliō (“I leap or spring back”).

adjectives.description: resilient (comparative more resilient, superlative most resilient)

definitionGroups.group: (of objects or substances) Returning quickly to original shape after force is applied; elastic.

entries.meaning: (materials science) Having the ability to absorb energy when deformed.

definitionGroups.group: (of systems, organisms or people) Returning quickly to normal after damaging events or conditions.

entries.meaning: (psychology, neuroscience) Having the ability to recover from mental illness, trauma, etc.; having resilience.
